step1.sentence: I wouldn't wear that color myself, but to each their own.

step2.story: My coworker puts hot sauce on everything, even his morning cereal. I tried it once and nearly choked, but to each their own — he's been doing it happily for years.

step3.story: When Lisa moved into her new apartment, she painted every wall a different bright color — lime green in the kitchen, electric blue in the bedroom, and bright orange in the living room. Her friends couldn't hide their shock during the housewarming party. 'Isn't it a bit… intense?' asked Tom, staring at the purple bathroom ceiling. Lisa just laughed and said she'd always dreamed of living inside a rainbow. The others exchanged glances, but nobody argued. To each their own, they figured — at least Lisa was genuinely happy every time she walked through her front door.

meaning.realUsageKo: 다른 사람의 취향이나 선택이 나와 다르더라도 존중한다는 의미로 사용합니다. 동의하지 않지만 굳이 반대하지 않을 때 자주 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 라틴어 'suum cuique'(각자에게 각자의 몫을)에서 유래했으며, 영어에서는 16세기부터 사용된 표현입니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 가볍고 관용적인 어조로, 판단 없이 상대의 다름을 인정할 때 씁니다. 약간의 어깨를 으쓱하는 느낌이 담겨 있습니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: He likes pineapple on pizza — well, to each their own.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그는 피자에 파인애플을 좋아해 — 뭐, 각자 취향이 있는 거지.
